page.title: 15The Oldest Pub in Sefton
page.content: Before local reorganisation in 1974 the Scotch Piper was known as the oldest pub in Lancashire.It was built in 1320 and is nowadays a fine biulding with a thatched roof.This attractive feature has also proved to be a problem.This year a fire destroyed the roof,it is believed that a chimney defect led to some of the roof timbers and thatch igniting.The pub has had its past disasters,22 years ago another fire destroyed the roof,it has suffered 3 floods and the the roof has blown off in a gale. This summer Charles Rigby and his wife Ada opened their doors again to the public.
